test-case.name: format-dateTime-004
test-case.description: Test format-dateTime: 12-hour clock
test-case.test: for $i in 1 to 24 return format-dateTime($t + xs:dayTimeDuration('PT1H')*$i, '[h].[m]')

test-case.name: format-dateTime-005
test-case.description: Test format-dateTime: upper-case roman numerals for year
test-case.test: string-join( for $i in 1 to 100 return format-dateTime($t + xs:yearMonthDuration('P1Y')*$i, '[YI]'), '; ')

result.assert-string-value: MCMLI; MCMLII; MCMLIII; MCMLIV; MCMLV; MCMLVI; MCMLVII; MCMLVIII; MCMLIX; MCMLX; MCMLXI; MCMLXII; MCMLXIII; MCMLXIV; MCMLXV; MCMLXVI; MCMLXVII; MCMLXVIII; MCMLXIX; MCMLXX; MCMLXXI; MCMLXXII; MCMLXXIII; MCMLXXIV; MCMLXXV; MCMLXXVI; MCMLXXVII; MCMLXXVIII; MCMLXXIX; MCMLXXX; MCMLXXXI; MCMLXXXII; MCMLXXXIII; MCMLXXXIV; MCMLXXXV; MCMLXXXVI; MCMLXXXVII; MCMLXXXVIII; MCMLXXXIX; MCMXC; MCMXCI; MCMXCII; MCMXCIII; MCMXCIV; MCMXCV; MCMXCVI; MCMXCVII; MCMXCVIII; MCMXCIX; MM; MMI; MMII; MMIII; MMIV; MMV; MMVI; MMVII; MMVIII; MMIX; MMX; MMXI; MMXII; MMXIII; MMXIV; MMXV; MMXVI; MMXVII; MMXVIII; MMXIX; MMXX; MMXXI; MMXXII; MMXXIII; MMXXIV; MMXXV; MMXXVI; MMXXVII; MMXXVIII; MMXXIX; MMXXX; MMXXXI; MMXXXII; MMXXXIII; MMXXXIV; MMXXXV; MMXXXVI; MMXXXVII; MMXXXVIII; MMXXXIX; MMXL; MMXLI; MMXLII; MMXLIII; MMXLIV; MMXLV; MMXLVI; MMXLVII; MMXLVIII; MMXLIX; MML

test-case.name: format-dateTime-006
test-case.description: Test format-dateTime: lower-case roman numerals for year (with the width specifier padded)

modified.change: Change in response to spec bug 29765
Change in response to spec bug 29833

test-case.test: string-join( for $i in 1 to 100 return format-dateTime($t + xs:yearMonthDuration('P17Y')*$i, '[Yi,3-3]'), '; ')

result.assert-string-value: dcccxvii; dcccxxxiv; dcccli; dccclxviii; dccclxxxv; cmii; cmxix; cmxxxvi; cmliii; cmlxx; cmlxxxvii; iv ; xxi; xxxviii; lv ; lxxii; lxxxix; cvi; cxxiii; cxl; clvii; clxxiv; cxci; ccviii; ccxxv; ccxlii; cclix; cclxxvi; ccxciii; cccx; cccxxvii; cccxliv; ccclxi; ccclxxviii; cccxcv; cdxii; cdxxix; cdxlvi; cdlxiii; cdlxxx; cdxcvii; dxiv; dxxxi; dxlviii; dlxv; dlxxxii; dxcix; dcxvi; dcxxxiii; dcl; dclxvii; dclxxxiv; dcci; dccxviii; dccxxxv; dcclii; dcclxix; dcclxxxvi; dccciii; dcccxx; dcccxxxvii; dcccliv; dccclxxi; dccclxxxviii; cmv; cmxxii; cmxxxix; cmlvi; cmlxxiii; cmxc; vii; xxiv; xli; lviii; lxxv; xcii; cix; cxxvi; cxliii; clx; clxxvii; cxciv; ccxi; ccxxviii; ccxlv; cclxii; cclxxix; ccxcvi; cccxiii; cccxxx; cccxlvii; ccclxiv; ccclxxxi; cccxcviii; cdxv; cdxxxii; cdxlix; cdlxvi; cdlxxxiii; d

test-case.name: format-dateTime-006a
test-case.description: Test format-dateTime: lower-case roman numerals for year (with the width specifier padded). Variant of test-case format-dateTime-006

test-case.name: format-dateTime-009
test-case.description: Test format-dateTime: test format-dateTime: ISO week numbers Specifically, in the ISO calendar the days of the week are numbered from 1 (Monday) to 7 (Sunday), and week 1 in any calendar year is the week (from Monday to Sunday) that includes the first Thursday of that year.

test-case.name: format-dateTime-010
test-case.description: test format-dateTime: ISO day within week Specifically, in the ISO calendar the days of the week are numbered from 1 (Monday) to 7 (Sunday), and week 1 in any calendar year is the week (from Monday to Sunday) that includes the first Thursday of that year.

test-case.name: format-dateTime-011
test-case.description: Test format-dateTime: ISO week number within month. Specifically, in the ISO calendar the days of the week are numbered from 1 (Monday) to 7 (Sunday), and week 1 in any calendar year is the week (from Monday to Sunday) that includes the first Thursday of that year.

modified.change: See spec bug 21370 and test bug 21794

test-case.name: format-dateTime-012
test-case.description: test format-dateTime(): a,b,c... numbering sequence (not actually useful but allowed by the spec...
test-case.test: for $i in 1 to 60 return format-dateTime($t + xs:dayTimeDuration('PT61S')*$i, '[mA].[sa]')

result.assert-string-value: P.g Q.h R.i S.j T.k U.l V.m W.n X.o Y.p Z.q AA.r AB.s AC.t AD.u AE.v AF.w AG.x AH.y AI.z AJ.aa AK.ab AL.ac AM.ad AN.ae AO.af AP.ag AQ.ah AR.ai AS.aj AT.ak AU.al AV.am AW.an AX.ao AY.ap AZ.aq BA.ar BB.as BC.at BD.au BE.av BF.aw BG.ax 0.ay A.az B.ba C.bb D.bc E.bd F.be G.bf H.bg J.0 K.a L.b M.c N.d O.e P.f

test-case.name: format-dateTime-019a
test-case.description: Test format-dateTime(): timezone is adjusted based on Olson timezone name. Section 9.8.4.3: "If the $place argument is supplied in the form of an Olson timezone name that is recognized by the implementation, then the date or time being formatted is adjusted to the timezone offset applicable in that timezone. For example, if the xs:dateTime value 2010-02-15T12:00:00Z is formatted with the $place argument set to America/New_York, then the output will be as if the value 2010-02-15T07:00:00-05:00 had been supplied.

test-case.name: format-dateTime-019b
test-case.description: Test format-dateTime(): timezone is adjusted based on Olson timezone name. Section 9.8.4.3: "...This adjustment takes daylight savings time into account where possible; if the date in question falls during daylight savings time in New York, then it is adju sted to timezone offset -PT4H rather than -PT5H.

test-case.name: format-dateTime-019c
test-case.description: Test format-dateTime(): timezone is adjusted based on Olson timezone name. Section 9.8.4.2: "If the first presentation modifier is N, then the timezone is output (where possible) as a timezone name, for example EST or CET. The same timezone offset has different names in different places...

test-case.name: format-dateTime-019d
test-case.description: Test format-dateTime(): timezone is adjusted based on Olson timezone name. Section 9.8.4.2: "...This adjustment takes daylight savings time into account where possible; if the date in question falls during daylight savings time in New York, then it is adjusted to timezone offset -PT4H rather than -PT5H.

test-case.name: format-dateTime-019e
test-case.description: Test format-dateTime(): timezone is adjusted based on Olson timezone name. Section 9.8.4.3: "If the $place argument is supplied in the form of an Olson timezone name that is recognized by the implementation, then the date or time being formatted is adjusted to the timezone offset applicable in that timezone. For example, if the xs:dateTime value 2010-02-15T12:00:00Z is formatted with the $place argument set to America/New_York, then the output will be as if the value 2010-02-15T07:00:00-05:00 had been supplied.

test-case.name: format-dateTime-025a
test-case.description: Reproduce the table in section 9.8.4.6 of the spec, but with dateTime values

test-case.name: format-dateTime-025b
test-case.description: Reproduce the table in section 9.8.4.6 of the spec (penultimate row), but with dateTime values in winter
test-case.test:
<out>{
           let $times := ('-10:00', '-05:00', 'Z', '+05:30', '+13:00') ! xs:dateTime('2018-01-01T12:00:00' || .)
           for $f in ('[ZN]') 
              return <time format="{$f}">{
                 for $t in $times
                 return <s>{format-dateTime($t, $f, (), (), "us")}</s>
            }</time>   
         }</out>

test-case.name: format-dateTime-025c
test-case.description: Reproduce the table in section 9.8.4.6 of the spec (last row), but with dateTime values in winter
test-case.test:
<out>{
           let $times := ('-10:00', '-05:00', 'Z', '+05:30', '+13:00') ! xs:dateTime('2018-01-01T12:00:00' || .)
           for $f in ('[H00]:[m00] [ZN]') 
              return <time format="{$f}">{
                 for $t in $times
                 return <s>{format-dateTime($t, $f, (), (), "America/New_York")}</s>
            }</time>   
         }</out>

test-case.name: format-dateTime-025d
test-case.description: Reproduce the table in section 9.8.4.6 of the spec (penultimate row), but with dateTime values in summer
test-case.test:
<out>{
           let $times := ('-10:00', '-05:00', 'Z', '+05:30', '+13:00') ! xs:dateTime('2018-07-01T12:00:00' || .)
           for $f in ('[ZN]') 
              return <time format="{$f}">{
                 for $t in $times
                 return <s>{format-dateTime($t, $f, (), (), "us")}</s>
            }</time>   
         }</out>

test-case.name: format-dateTime-025e
test-case.description: Reproduce the table in section 9.8.4.6 of the spec (last row), but with dateTime values in summer
test-case.test:
<out>{
           let $times := ('-10:00', '-05:00', 'Z', '+05:30', '+13:00') ! xs:dateTime('2018-07-01T12:00:00' || .)
           for $f in ('[H00]:[m00] [ZN]') 
              return <time format="{$f}">{
                 for $t in $times
                 return <s>{format-dateTime($t, $f, (), (), "America/New_York")}</s>
            }</time>   
         }</out>

test-case.name: format-dateTime-801err
test-case.description: Error XTDE1340 incorrect picture string

test-case.name: format-dateTime-en141
test-case.description: English BC/AD

test-case.name: format-dateTime-en142
test-case.description: English AM/PM
test-case.test: for $i in 0 to 23 return let $t := $b + xs:dayTimeDuration('PT1H')*$i return translate(format-dateTime($t, '[h]~[m][P]', 'en', (), ()), '.- ', '')

test-case.name: format-dateTime-en143
test-case.description: English noon/midnight. The US convention seems to be noon=AM, midnight=PM, and as no-one except the US uses the 12-hour clock these days, we'll go with that.
test-case.test: for $i in 0 to 1 return let $t := $b + xs:dayTimeDuration('PT12H')*$i return translate(format-dateTime($t, '[h]~[m][P]', 'en', (), ()), '.- ', '')

test-case.name: format-dateTime-en151
test-case.description: test format-dateTime: fallback to English for unsupported language. Test assumes (a) that Iberian (xib) is not supported, and (b) that the fallback language is English. Changed from lang="fo" to lang="xib": See bug 862.
